poem:
### The Price of Progress

In halls where whispers light on air,  
decisions scrawl a future, bare.  
A tax cut wraps its callous arm,  
strips 830,000 hearts of calm.  
Bills climb unseen hills, steep, taut;  
smog laces skies, our breath distraught.  
Yet hope survives in soil and sun—  
a quiet protest yet begun.
